cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, then turning north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana/Mississippi) on Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA (well east of Texas coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; Storm-Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River, LA to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty squalls possible, sustained winds generally below 30 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Galveston Bay/Texas City Channel
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain on Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very low tornado or lightning risk associated with peripheral rain bands
